description:
DBBUG Technical Talks and Summer Social

Date: Tuesday 22nd October
Location: Runway East, 1 Victoria St, Bristol, BS1 6AA

Massive thank you to our Sponsors Elucidata and Jumptrading for their kindness in supporting this event with venue hire, food and drinks!

If you are interested in giving a talk, please put down your name, company and talk title on the spreadsheet below

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1WvH-AiERXO7Cuv11PaYmpw7BPtTpI2pW9brdCiekR4g/edit#gid=0

🕖Schedule
============
18:00 - 19:00 - Networking with drinks
19:00 - 19:05 - Welcome
19:05 - 19:10 - Jumptrading (Sponsor Intro)
19:10 - 19:15 - Elucidata (Sponsor Intro)
19:15 - 19:25 - Romain: "Building Jump's monitoring and alerting system"
19:25 - 19:35 - Rob: "Semantic Releases in CI/CD"
19:35 - 19:45 - Ed: "Coding a utility in Python vs Go"
19:45 - 19:55 - Louis: "What's new in Python 3.8"
20:00 - 20:15 - Networking
20:15 - 23:59 - Drinks at The Left Handed Giant

🕖 LOGISTICS
==============

Doors open at 18:00, talks kick off at 19:00 sharp. There will be a designated pub to head towards afterwards.

We're limited on the number of attendees, so if you realise you can't make it, please unRSVP in good time to free up your place for your fellow community members.

Follow @robcharlwood (https://twitter.com/robcharlwood) for updates on this and future events, as well as announcements and news from the local python community.

📜 CODE OF CONDUCT
=======================

Be kind to others. Do not insult or put down others. Behave professionally. Remember that harassment and sexist, racist, or exclusionary jokes and language are not appropriate for DBBUG.

All communication should be appropriate for a professional audience including people of many different backgrounds. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate.

DBBUG is dedicated to providing a harassment-free event experience for everyone, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

Thank you for helping make this a welcoming, friendly community for all.

To discuss any issues or concerns relating to the code of conduct or the behaviour of anyone at a DBBUG meet up, please contact the group organisers - Rob Charlwood and Ed Crewe.
title: DBBUG Autumn Technical Talks and Social
